intro: Reichardia glauca, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist to wet soils, often found in marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Reichardia glauca has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered flower heads. It is an important plant in wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
